title: PBX Phone System
description: This project involves implementing a 3CX Phone System on on-premises hardware with physical handsets, a SIP Trunk with two channels, and a new internet connection to replace the existing Telstra services, enhancing communication and connectivity for the client.

sections.title: Cover Letter
sections.description:
I am pleased to present this proposal for the implementation of the 3CX Phone System, which we believe will offer significant improvements in both your communication capabilities and overall efficiency. As part of this proposal, we are recommending the setup of a robust, on-premises solution with physical handsets, an integrated SIP Trunk, and two dedicated channels (lines) for seamless and reliable communication.


In addition, we will be providing a new internet connection to replace your existing Telstra services. This will ensure a more reliable and high-performance internet experience, designed to fully support the needs of your communication system.


The proposed 3CX Phone System is an advanced, yet easy-to-manage platform that supports voice, video, and messaging services. By combining it with the latest hardware and reliable SIP Trunking technology, we aim to deliver a cost-effective solution that improves your business’s ability to stay connected, whether in the office or remotely.


We are confident that this proposal will not only meet your technical needs but will also streamline communication across your organization, improving productivity and collaboration. Should you have any questions or require further details, I am happy to discuss the specifics at your convenience.


Thank you for considering our proposal. We look forward to working together on this project and delivering a solution tailored to your business’s requirements.

items.description:
Business Internet Service

You are currently using Telstra Business Internet; I recommend switching to Exetel.

- https://business.exetel.com.au/small-business/nbn

items.title: Exetel Business - Start Up NBN Plan - Up to 100/40 Mbps
items.description:
This includes the following

- Unlimited Data.

- Up to 100/40 Mbps Speeds.

- 5x Speed Upgrade Days Per Month.

- Five (5) Minute Support Guarantee.

- Extended business hours support.

- 1x Static IP Address (Required for on-premises phone system).

- No lock-in contract.


Promo Discount

- $85.00 Per Month, for the first six (6) months, then $105.00 Per Month ongoing.


* This service is billed directly to 'Bananacoast Freight Couriers' from the third-party vendor.

Business Voice Service

You are currently using Telstra Business Voice; I recommend switching over to Aatrox Communications.

- https://aatroxcommunications.com.au/pricing/

items.title: Aatrox Communications - Capped - SIP Line
items.description:
This includes the following

- Provides 1 Channel & Hosts 1 Number

- Local & National Calls @ $0.00; Local Calls are included within the Capped Call Plans

- Mobile Calls @ $0.00; Local Calls are included within the Capped Call Plans

- 13/1300 Calls @ $0.35 Per Call; Untimed, to any 13/1300 number.

- International Calls @ $0.029 Per Minute; Billed per second with no flagfall or minimum.

- 1 Month Minimum Contract


* This service is billed directly to 'Bananacoast Freight Couriers' from the third-party vendor.

** Monthly service charges will be billed two months in advance. Call usage relevant to your SIP Trunk type will be billed a month in arrears

items.title: Aatrox Communications - Pay As You Go - SIP Line
items.description:
This includes the following

- Provides 1 Channel & Hosts 1 Number

- Local & National Calls $0.10 Per Call; Untimed to any national or local number in Australia

- Mobile Calls @ $0.10 Per Minute; Billed per second with no flagfall or minimum.

- 13/1300 Calls @ $0.35 Per Call; Untimed, to any 13/ 1300 number.

- International Calls @ $0.029 Per Minute; Billed per second with no flagfall or minimum.

- 1 Month Minimum Contract


* This service is billed directly to 'Bananacoast Freight Couriers' from the third-party vendor.

** Monthly service charges will be billed two months in advance. Call usage relevant to your SIP Trunk type will be billed a month in arrears

Desktop

This hardware will used to replace the existing Desktop used by (Robert H); the existing system will be refurbished and utilised to host the phone system.

items.title: Lenovo ThinkCentre Tiny Neo 50q Gen 4
items.description:
Specifications

- 13th Gen Intel Core i5-13420H

- Windows 11 Pro 64-bit

- Integrated Intel® UHD Graphics for 13th Gen Intel® Processors

- 16 GB DDR4-3200MHz (SODIMM)

- 512 GB SSD M.2 2280 PCIe Gen4 TLC Opal

- USB Calliope Mouse (Black)

- Intel Wi-Fi 6 AX201 2x2 AX & Bluetooth® 5.1 or above

- 3 Year Onsite Warranty

items.title: 4Cabling - 1.5m - RJ45 CAT6 Ethernet Network Cable - Blue

items.description:
Networking

This will be used to replace the existing Telstra Business router, and network switch sitting in the rear corner of the demountable office.

Deskphones

This hardware will be used to replace the existing deskphones, plus include an additional DECT Business Phone

Estimated - Professional Services Labour
items.description:
This covers the following:

- Collaborating with third-party technical support to transfer numbers and services to the new provider.

- Configuring third-party vendor systems to meet Phone System requirements.

- Testing and troubleshooting to ensure full compatibility and performance.

items.title: Estimated - Professional Services Labour
items.description:
This covers the following:

- Pre-configuring 3CX system for deployment, ensuring all settings are aligned with organizational needs.

- Configuring hardware, including phones and deskphones, for compatibility with the 3CX system.

- Setting up network infrastructure to support the 3CX deployment.

- Performing system tests to ensure functionality and readiness for go-live.

items.title: Estimated - Professional Services Labour
items.description:
This covers the following:

- Onsite deployment of 3CX system, including hardware and software installation.

- Configuration of network settings and integration with existing systems.

- Providing hands-on training to end users on how to effectively use the 3CX system.

- Offering support during the initial usage phase to address any issues or questions.

milestones.title: Project Kickoff
milestones.description: Initial project planning, requirements gathering, and timeline setup.

milestones.title: Development Phase Completion
milestones.description: Functional prototype of the project with core features implemented.

milestones.title: Final Delivery & Deployment
milestones.description: Fully tested and deployed project ready for client use.

sections.title: Terms and Conditions
sections.description:
1. Scope of Work

The Service Provider will perform the Services as described in the accompanying proposal ("Proposal"). Any additional work requested by the Client beyond the agreed scope will require a written change order and may incur additional costs.


2. Project Timeline

The timeline for delivery of the Services is outlined in the Proposal. While the Service Provider will make every effort to meet these timelines, they are estimates and may be adjusted due to unforeseen circumstances. Any changes will be communicated promptly to the Client.


3. Payment Terms

3.1 Fees: Payment terms, including fees, are outlined in the Proposal. All payments are due as specified in the payment schedule.

3.2 Late Payments: Late payments may be subject to a penalty of [X]% per month on the outstanding balance.

3.3 Taxes:The Client is responsible for all applicable taxes unless otherwise specified.


4. Client Responsibilities

The Client agrees to provide timely access to relevant personnel, systems, and information required for the execution of the Services. Approve or provide feedback on deliverables within agreed timelines. Ensure third-party dependencies (if any) are fulfilled.


5. Ownership and Intellectual Property

5.1 Deliverables: Upon full payment, ownership of the final deliverables will transfer to the Client. The Service Provider retains the right to use any pre-existing tools, libraries, or frameworks integrated into the deliverables.

5.2 License: Any software, frameworks, or libraries used by the Service Provider that are not custom-built remain the intellectual property of their respective owners.

5.3 Service Provider IP: The Service Provider retains ownership of any proprietary methodologies, templates, or tools used in providing the Services.


6. Confidentiality

Both parties agree to maintain the confidentiality of all proprietary and sensitive information shared during the course of the project. Confidential information shall not be disclosed to third parties without prior written consent.


7. Limitation of Liability

The Service Provider’s total liability for any claims related to this Agreement will be limited to the fees paid by the Client for the Services. The Service Provider is not liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from the use of deliverables or Services.


8. Warranties and Representations

8.1 Service Provider: The Service Provider warrants that the Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner.

8.2 Client: The Client warrants that any materials, content, or data provided for the Services are owned by the Client or that the Client has the necessary rights to use them.


9. Termination

9.1 By Client: The Client may terminate the Agreement with 15 days' written notice. Fees for work completed up to the termination date will be invoiced and must be paid in full.

9.2 By Service Provider: The Service Provider may terminate the Agreement if the Client fails to meet payment or other obligations under this Agreement, with 15 days' written notice.


10. Force Majeure

Neither party shall be held liable for delays or failure to fulfill obligations due to causes beyond their reasonable control, including but not limited to natural disasters, strikes, or government regulations.


11. Dispute Resolution

Any disputes arising from this Agreement shall first be resolved through good-faith negotiations. If a resolution cannot be reached, disputes will be submitted to binding arbitration under the rules of [Arbitration Organization].


12. Governing Law

This Agreement is governed by the laws of [Your Jurisdiction].


13. Entire Agreement

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all prior agreements, representations, and understandings.


14. Amendments

Any amendments to this Agreement must be made in writing and signed by both parties.
